availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John J. Swetnam (Bath County, Kentucky, 1st lieut Bath Co Rangers & 1st Reg Cap Guards)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Thomas Swetnam and Mary “Polly” Atchison Swetnam. Student in Bath County in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Served in Captain Bussey’s Bath County Rangers as a first lieutenant from December 11, 1863, to April 1, 1864. Served in the First Regiment Capital Guards, Frankfort Battalion, as a first lieutenant from February 1, 1864, to his resignation on July 14, 1864.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 256.

U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #827.465, Certificate #608.584.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA,Film 7016219: All Counties, 1918-1919, File #15289, p. 2146 of 3360 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
